heading: ebay tangles with the feds
subheading: ebay's big stock split is set for monday, but the company announced friday it was under federal investigation for those fraudulent transactions taking place on its site. by polly sprenger.
author: polly sprenger
text: ebay is under investigation from a federal agency, the company said late friday. without disclosing what agency was working on the investigation, ebay said it had been contacted by government agents on 29 january, and was asked to produce documentation about specific sales "relating to an investigation of possible illegal transactions in connection with the company's site," the statement said.the government agency is also examining ebay's business practices with regards to reports of fraudulent transactions.on 25 january, ebay confirmed that the new york city department of consumer affairs was investigating the site for alleged trades involving counterfeit items.recently, ebay has tried to combat news of these investigations with announcements that it is banning firearms sales on the site and stepping up its discipline practices to curb illegal sales.full story to follow.
